reviews.review_msg: He was just as confused as I was all semester long. He didn't even know his grading criteria or rubric and made stuff up as he went.
Tough grader and pop quizzes, horrible at teaching very lazy

BORING lectures veryyyyyy boring. Does not know how to teach, you could pay me to just read off the slides better than he does. Come on "Engaging University" yet we sit through him going on and on reading off of a powerpoint. I learned nothing from this class. I want a refund.

Professor Seah was absolutely useless when it came to feedback or help. He did not even bother replying to his emails at times. His exams were not related to his lecture notes or book. Overall forces you to come to class with his pop quizzes that count towards a big portion of ur exams. Beware of this guy he thinks he is funny but no way!

Albert essentially reads the textbook word for word in lectures, but you still need to go in case of a pop quiz. He does not give any feedback or tips on how to do better. He seems to think that he can be funny, but it often comes across as mean instead. He also likes to start class early, so give yourself time to get to class.

not a good prof. has pop quizzes at the end of lectures. these pop quizzes count towards your midterm mark and can easily lower it. does not give adequate time to complete midterm and especially final exam. also, he does not go over any due assignments in class, he makes it your responsibility to know when it's due and how to do it.

Inconsiderate prof, his classes were so boring to sit through. I wish i had taken a different Prof. The prof was petty and didnt care. Goes off topic. In conclusion dont take him you will suffer as his notes are not like the multiple choice during exams!

Actual garbage prof who is extremely biased and rude. Lectures are dry and is a waste of time but forces assignments in lecture to bump up attendance. Additionally, his lectures go way off topic on multiple occasions and often targets students who choose to not listen to him read off a screen

She's an nice prof but I found myself bored in her lectures. Her lectures are 95% based from the textbook and 5% on related topics but she'll most likely test out of those related topics and really specific details from the book. The assignments aren't too bad for this course but I probably wouldn't take a course with her again.

She's a decent lecturer, but gives an unnecessary amount of homework. Be ready for individual assignments, weekly quizzes, MyMIS Lab simulations, and a large group assignment on top of the heavily weighted midterm and final. Would not take a course with her again.

Zorana can keep class entertaining through students' participation. She is capable at teaching the subject. She is available outside of class. She can explain to you very wellany questions or course material you are unsure of  The exams are fair. Her notes are great for studying for them. I would take another class with her again if i could

You probably have a choice of two profs for 237, Svedic and Masri.  If so then pick Masri. I was in Svedic's class while my friend was taking the same course with Masri. It was like we were on different planets and my friend was on the good one.

Overall she's a pretty interesting lecturer, but i find her exams are quite difficult. She wants creative answers on the exams. Although sometimes she rush through the slides, I still strongly recommend you to go to class because she explains the slides pretty clearly most of the time.

Entertaining lectures, nice person, readily available and wanting to help you out. A decent amount of assignments and work involved throughout the course. Final and midterm weren't that bad either. Overall would recommend!
Zorana is a great lecturer and and gives fair exams.

Easy course, and I loved the online quizzes. Why? For one, they're super easy. Read the chapter before class and you'll get 1415 or higher. Which is what you should be doing anyways. Assignments are tedious, especially MISlab. Grading was fair, but make sure you know about porters models by heart for midterm 1.

Very light content of course, everything is directly from the textbook and she is so tech savvy that you could essentially treat this as an online course. She is available for help and super clear. Very easy course!

course material was a bit dry but Zorana did her best to keep the lectures interesting. she is very nice and I liked her informal attitude during lectures. midterm was on the easy side but final was very difficult.

Zorana is a great teacher. Very chill and very student oriented. First business class as I am now doing a minor, and I only have good things to say. Labs are not related, they are like their own class, but they are easy as well. Just read the book and you'll be fine. It is actually kinda interesting as well!

60% of the marks are from midterm and final.  The other 40% is from assignments, projects, and other stuff.  The 40% is very easy to ace, however, I found her midterm and final extremely difficult; not because the material is hard, but because her questions are phrased weirdly and are very ambiguous in meaning.  She's a nice person though.
Her lectures are orgnized and lecture notes are very helpful when u prapare for the midterm. TA is very important.Never take Inigo.

She is really helpful and tries to make a boring class interesting. Make sure you attend class and take notes on what to study when she tells you. Read the textbook and your good. Cant wait to take 272 with her !!

The material is seriously DULL. The book actually said so too, but Zorana tries to make everything interesting and funny, and she is entertaining herself. The only thing that upset me is that the class is bell curved, and the other 237 class had a lower average than us so ppl there had lower exam scores but higher final grades than us cuz of that.

Good Prof!! definitely knows her stuff and she makes funny comments now and then with her spunky personality. Keep in mind though that the exams are pretty tough but as long as you read the textbook and notes, you'll do fine! I actually came here and read good reviews about her beforehand, and IT'S TRUE!! so I definitely recommend her! :)
Ok, I enjoyed her classes and teaching style. However, since course it self is TOO much informative, I find tests QUITE hard (don't think that MC will make your life easy). So..take her xD

Her notes are so organized, very helpful when you need to prepare for exams. However, I hate BUS 237! Useless content, time-consuming assignments plus ridiculous high average. I never be able to pay attention on her words.

Let's just say for the spring10 semester, I felt like I was taking a distance ed. course.  We do an online quiz before she teaches so what's the point of showing up to class?  To make it worse, the class was at 830am too.  Assignments were ok, but VERY time consuming.  Only useful thing I learned in this course was using Word/Excel productively.

Lectures not mandatory - memorize the textbook and her powerpoints and you'll do fine on exams. 2 easy assignments, 1 group project. Midterm/Final is pure MC, just alot of memorization. 2 VERY easy microsoft office tests, and weekly open-book online quizzes

She's "generally" a nice prof. She can be rude sometimes. The projects are so tedious. The projects are so different from the lecture content and you end up spending hours on something worth so little. The exam procedures are crazy too. She doesn't let people go to the bathroom and spends 1 hour just collecting ids. Ridiculous.
she is a good prof, make the material kinda interesting sometime. however,It's not an A course at all u need to WORK HARD ! the course cover lots n lots of material n need lots of work.

She is a wonderful prof, very approachable and helpful! Her exams are all MC, they can be a bit tricky but overall, they are fair. It is IMPORTANT that you read the textbook and attend her lectures! Just try your best to keep up with all the quizzes, assignments and group project... they are not that difficult. Well, I had fun with this course :)

zorana cares about her student and wants them to do well. lectures are pointless, exams are easy, but 1st assignment was very tedious and annoying. shes very quirky and very personable and apporachable. her surrey office has all these anime toys!

To me, this course was dryer than dirt. There was nothing wrong with zorana's teaching. Her exams were average and assignments are easy. The course is not hard to study; it's just that the context is long dry and dull. Just my 2 cents.

She's overall a fair teacher. Seemed interesting in the subject. I have no complaints about her teaching. Curve was a little high: Your mark will depend on how other ppl do and your interest in computers.

very nice prof!! its a bus class so not gonna say its 'easy A' cause of the curve, but how well you do on the mt & final depends on how much you study. assignments were ANNOYING- little suprises in marking, but definitely recommend her!!

RECOMMENDED prof for MIS!! All exams are MC... lots of memorizing (that's only becuz of the course content) assignments are easy (and quite fun, i thought) MUST GET TEXTBOOK... textbook is pretty short and easy to understand, very helpful... prof is approachable, friendly, and always in a good mood!! totally recommended!!

i took this class a while back, but Z is still one of my favorite professors i've had so far. friendly, approachable, and knowledgable. she is so quick to respond to questions it is mind-boggling! she's just an overall great person with a very lively personality. i wish she taught more undergrad classes because i'd take the course in a heartbeat!

must attend lectures. when studying - study from her lecture notes AND textbook. i wouldn't say it's an "easy A" - it is A LOT of memorization and studying. she tries to make class interesting but personally, i'm not that into computers so i often fall asleep. but zorana is super nice and bubbly and i would definitely recommend taking her class!

Well organized and interested in the material. Lectures are somewhat fun and informal. Exam questions were almost all memorization questions, but some were quite small details. If you have prior technical knowledge or are willing to study hard, it should be an easy A+!

Great Prof. Knows how to make boring material interesting. Assignments are very time consuming, but easy.  Have to read every chapter to do good on  online quizzes.  Overall, easy A as long as you put in effort in assignments and other homework.

Zorana is an awesome teacher.  loves to help students and is more than fair in marking. My TA Gaith was also incredible.  The combination made this class extremely enjoyable for me and I lrnd alot. Txt by krnke was good but really  annoying because of the guides throughout the book which served no purpose except to allow Kr. to talk about his life.

she's such a nice person! and her personality is just great. the course material can be hard and there's a lot to memorize... but u gotta listen to what she says in class and memorize... then u'll do fine for sure.. and she has this bonus question for her final and it's all m/c
She explains everything clearly and is easy to understand.

prof is friendly and helpful, exams all mc can be tricky and assignment requires time but actually pretty easy.  course is pretty useless but its actually kinda easy no need go lec just study her notes~

The material is rather boring, but Zorana does what she can to make it more interesting. Going to lecture has some added value since she points out key exam concepts. The assignments are marked easily, but require a lot of time for a small percentage of the grade. If you're good at memorization, this course is really easy.
she'very hard.
Easy class, just make sure to take note of the slides that she says are important and memorize the textbook. Labs are useless. She's actually pretty helpful easy to get a hold of.
Easiest class I've taken at SFU so far

Zorana's lectures are pretty boring.  Her lecture notes are all on WebCT.  The course material is very dry and the the specifications she gives for assignments are too vague.  However, she is helpful and replies to questions quickly.  Zorana does a good job of explaining the slides but course is a lot of memorization.

The subject was boring, very dry material. The Midterm was hard, the final was easier. Make sure to attend lecture and memorize important slides which she will indicate. labs were useless. try to study the textbook aswell if you can. if you have time to read everything you'll do fine, to do great memorize everything (lecture notes, textbook)

puts a lot of effort into her teaching. replies very fast to questions on the discussion. The course generally is hard and needs a lot of studying. The more studying = the better mark! But she gives hints as to which slides will be on the exam in lecture, so pay attention!

Good lecturer, ugly shoes. The class was pretty hard, the midterm kills you, but not so hard that it's impossible. You just have to read the material. Really great at answering questions on WebCT, and the assignments were actually kind of fun.

It's hard to do well in this course, but it's really not hard compared to Accounting or Econ. Zorana is new, but very good at lecturing, made the course fun so you enjoyed going to class, and she is very fair.

What happens when you cover short man syndrome and childhood neglect with a layer of arrogance? You get Peter tingling. Peter's anecdotes, which he spends most of his lectures on, mainly include his wife and his "superiority." He is the part of BBA that everyone wants to avoid. Take his course to learn about the bad people of the business world.
good prof
Very intelligent and approachable guy, would definitely recommend him. Fair grader and you'll learn a lot.

Far too full of himself. Tingling is one of those people who is very knowledgeable but has very little personable qualities. His lectures are hard and off Topic. He is rude and unfair. Condescending is a word that springs to mind. If you want to do well, do NOT take the course with him, otherwise be prepared for the most work you have ever done.
Class is fair, just study and you'll be fine

Avoid him if you can! This professor is full of himself and often spend the majority of class time talking about irrelevant things. He makes the exam extremely hard which is funny because when in class, everything he talks about sounds simple and he gives very little explanation on the technical parts.

He picks random people in lectures to answer questions, most of them are opinion based,  but i'd rather he open up a discussion where people can express their opinions if they choose to.  He tries to make the class interesting but I literally have to force myself to attend his lectures. He is not the best prof for 237.

I took Bus 201 and Bus 237 with Peter.  Lectures were dull at points and not necessary to attend but he does do a good job of relating course material to current events.  Exams are straightforward for the most part but he marks written answers himself and is a tough grader.

He gives you all the material you need to know in the lecture slides.  The exams are 60 multiple choice & 4 short answer questions. The final is cumulative and it is difficult. The assignments are alright - the grading depends on your TA.
tough graded but good pro
Avoid Peter if you can, you will prob fail his class without sufficient readings. The assignments take up a lot of time but worth very little.

Super tough Tests, the rest of the content is very easy including the weekly quizzes. the quizzes are word for word from the book but the tests have very tricky multiple choice. It's definitely one of those "choose the best answer" type.

The lectures are really essential for passing. He basically gives you the material you need to know in class. Textbook is like the lecture. He makes you read it before class. It is good to read before because then you have a basic understanding before attending lecture.

hard exams, lectures quite boring and he frequently goes off topic. I found the assignments interesting, and it is important to do well on them if you want a good grade. Overall, not a prof I would recommend

I had a horrible time in this class. He changed due dates last minute often and he had us convinced it was all for the sake of fairness. All marks are final or fairness would have been violated. His lectures are disparate from his tests resulting in borderline failing averages and he releases no extra study materials.

OK, he tried very hard to be funny, but he is cold when you ask him some question!! he is hot in during the lecture, but after lecture, he is super cold! he do not want to answer any question, it seems asking him any question is wasting his time!!!
Prject marks are dependent on TA. midterm and final were based on everything in lecture. Shuna will tell you beforehand which written questions are based on certain lectures.
Great prof. She is informative and kind. She has high standards for her students so come prepared to learn and you will do fine.
Cant explain material well, test questions are very ambiguous, not helpful, TA should be the prof at this point

Lectures are so dry and boring because she basically just reads off the slides (at times she even seems confused by the material). Short answer questions for the final are based on in-class discussion questions, so don't skip even though the lectures are terrible. Assignments are time-consuming but at least somewhat useful if you have a good TA.

terrible prof. is not knowledgeable in the course topics what so ever. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. tests material that is not relevant to main course topics and no explanation for grades being given. not even put on canvas so no way to tell how you did or are doing. TERRIBLE PROFESSOR DOES NOT DESERVE TO TEACH UNIVERSITY LEVEL COURSES

The material itself is not difficult, but taking the course with this prof makes it so. Her lectures are very dry and boring - she just reads of her slides with very few of her own comments. Didn't really seem like she knew what she was doing. Short Answers on the finals were marked very hard. Was forced to buy the textbook brand new for MISlab.

By far the worst course and professor ever. Midterm is super easy to distract you and make you feel the same about the final whereas the final is TOTALLY the opposite. Short questions do not make any sense and are graded SO ROUGH. It's like they want you to guess what the question is. TAs dont help. Grading is super hard. Take it with a better prof
poor teaching skills and unfair midterm/finals. TA saved this course for a lot of people. AVOID her!!

Very boring, but final was open book. attendance is only mandatory for labs, but you prolly don't need to go to all the lectures. Everyone did lower than expected for midterm. final was easier than midterm, but you still need to understand the concepts or else you'll spend too much time looking thought your notes. only gave 100 mins for final.

Ina Wang (TA) helped us tremendously, thank you Ina. Connie is a terrible prof. She cannot speak clearly and gives very hard exams. Assignments worth 1% take 5 hours to do. Don't bother going to lectures, you cant understand her anyways and its not useful info. Connie is not a good prof.

Extremely boring lectures, really shouldve listened to the ratemyprofs damn. Her voice is very unique but in a way that makes u want to fall asleep. There were only 2 options 8:30am in burnaby or 2:30pm in Surrey so either struggle to stay awake or my entire day is kinda gone. Shes caring but simply cant teach, worst prof Ive had so far :/

Connie is the absolute worst professor I have ever had in all my years at SFU. Her assignments are unclear, she is a terrible lecturer, and all in all she makes the course far harder than it has to be. Avoid her AT ALL COSTS.
She was an alright prof. Lectures were pretty dry. Study the textbook and you should be fine.

If there is another professor for this course, choose them instead of Connie. Connie doesn't record her lectures and goes off-topic every lecture. Her lectures are hard to understand her marking criteria aren't clear. If you like cats and hearing her smart speaker talk, go ahead and pick this course.

Professor Azaron is very intelligent and knowledgable. However, he cannot teach at all and has poor time management. He ended every single lecture 20-30 minutes late which is unacceptable. He is very disrespectful during presentations; he cuts you off and criticizes your team before you even finish. Avoid at ALL costs!

Absolutely horrendous. I took this class after having read all the previous negative reviews of her, and yet I am still shocked at how bad of a teacher she is and how unprofessional she is. Lecture powerpoints dont match-up with the textbook, and she struggles to explain even the simplest of concepts. Hands down the worst prof I have ever had.

Assignments were confusing as instructions were unclear and her lectures were so boring as she mainly read off the slides. Short answers for midterm was so vague and misleading, the average was like 6/20 because it was unclear on how to answer the questions. Very tedious and frustrating.

Very inexperienced - she struggles just to READ the material off the slides and doesn't seem to know what she's doing. The short answers for the final are kind of confusing, especially when the course material is quite repetitive. Make sure you attend the lectures because she takes participation and in-class questions will be part of the final.

Very inexperienced professor who relied on her TAs for the duration of the semester. Her lectures are simply her reading the slides word for word and her exams are not representative of what her slides teach. The short answer portions are almost impossible to prepare for as there is so much content and little guidance.
Lack of communication especially regarding the Pearson e-textbook. Her lectures are boring as she just reads off of slides and her exams were complicated and misleading

Overall, very inexperienced and inconsistent. There are plenty of spelling and grammar mistakes in her unorganized slides. The course textbook does not align with her lectures either. She runs off to long breaks which could be used for teaching material that she is too lazy to cover. Also has a thick accent, which doesn't help.

Claims that the exam will be tested on textbook material, but provides information on her notes that have completely different definitions - makes it unclear which definition we should be studying. Also isn't clear about what the test is on and the format, no practice whatsoever.
-Assignment instructions are long and confusing. -Makes you explore trendy technologies, some are quite irrelevant and unnecessary. -lots of memorizing.
good prof, nothing outstanding but def knows his stuff
thanks to kamal, i could get an A+. Really passionate and cool.

Super friendly and engaging. Tends to go off tangent during lectures and lags behind by the first term. Infuses his experience with MIS into the lectures and teaches outside the scope of the course. Tough grader, tough exams, tough assignments. Be prepared to slog this course out.

Favourite professor thus far at SFU! This course requires lots of tedious work, but in the end is quite rewarding. If you are even remotely interested in technology, Kamal is terrific at igniting a passion for the subject that you didn't realize you previously had. Some of the material can get dry so his anecdotes keeps things interesting. :)

Great lecturer and includes lots of stories from his industry experience. Although the material is easy and straightforward the exams were hard since they test your understanding of the material and not just memorization. So much easy homework and easy assignments but the most time consuming classes I've taken and the ruberic  was tough too.
This course is not as easy as everyone says it is. Save yourself and take it with a different prof.
The course on the service isn't hard. But the marking is way too hard and the rules are too strict. Wouldn't recommend unless there are no other options.

Kamal is really engaging and makes fairly boring material become interesting. He has a ton of experience in the field and cares about his students' future. Make sure to stay up on the readings. Would highly recommend.

Kamal is an excellent prof.  Participation is very important to him,  and he makes an effort to get to know the students that do participate.  Material is boring,  but he does his best to make it interesting.  Go to class,  read the textbook,  and the material will stick.

His exams are tough since they are filled with tricky multiple choice questions but the good thing is that this course is curved(the top mark for the final exam was around 80%).The assignments are time consuming but sometimes interesting.

kamal is a great person, but not as great as a lecturer. the first and last lectures were my favorite.... and the middle were just meh. His exams are super hard and TRUST me when i say that this is not a class you can't just read the book. You have to UNDERSTAND the concepts.  Oh and get ready for group projects and individual ones, he watches too

The material is dry, midterm was multiple choice and short answers but really tricky. Text book doesn't help much. In order to do well, you have to understand the material rather than memorize the slides. Assignmentsand group project were VERY time-consuming.
To be fair, he is a great Prof and a nice person, fair marker as well.  But his midterm and final are really really hard.

Assignments took a long time, especially the second one.  Mentions a lot of interesting storiesarticles which relate to the topic.  He makes the class less boring and concepts do stick because of his stories.

This man is a great professor, teacher, educator, coach and an even better person. Work hard and you will do great. Great with emails and in-person. Awesome dude. Very clear with all details and wishes and really works to make his students succeed. Thank you Dr. Masri.
Excellent professor, works very hard to engage students with the course material. Do yourself a favour, and take a class with him! You won't be disappointed!
Great prof! Tries to make the topic relevant and interesting. Definitely recommend!

He's a nice guy and encourages a lot of discussion. Tries to make lectures interesting altho content can be boring. I hate how assignments are so time consuming, esp assign.#2, TAs hardly go thru it so you're left clueless and dont kno what ur doing, becuz they dont exactly explain it well in labs.

Great prof.  Made a not-so-interesting class fun.  Explains material well and great sense of humour. Just be careful with the assignments! They're very time consuming.  I would definitely recommend taking this class with him!

dont normally review profs but Dr. Masri deserves a shout out... One of the best profs ive ever had. Explains material well, fair assignments and marking, fair exams that require you to apply the material and think despite being MC. Helpful guy, funny, friendly, approachable. Take this class with him.

Kamal is a great teacher, I had so much fun attending his lecture. Taking in class notes is a must since he bases the exams on the lectures. His exams are a bit hard and tricky, all multiple choice with lots of all/none of the above. Assignments are time consuming but doable. Makes you think but if you paid attention during class you'll be fine.

not sure why this is here, but I don't think Eric teaches this class anymore at SFU. I hear many people want to know where he went and if he is still teaching 237. He made the course fun with dad jokes, but it was a memorable class!

Eric is an awesome TA. He's always willing to help his students on assignments, and he replies to emails very quickly! Eric will teach you a lot about Microsoft Office and he makes tutorials very engaging and interactive. If you're taking BUS237, make sure to take a tutorial with Eric.

Relatively easy class, minimal workload (was able to finish all assignments the week of). Asked TAs for help to nail the grade rubric. Stopped going to lectures after the first month as they were long, slow and boring. Just studied slides and textbook for exams.

The lectures can be boring but if you attend them he will help you with tests and any questions you have. Make sure you memorize the information from the slides as midterms and finals revolve around info from both slides and tb. He really cares about his students and wants them to do well. If you aren't attending lectures you're just wasting money.

Meysams lectures may be a bit dull, but he genuinely cares for his students success and is only hard and a bit mean because honestly his midterm was super easy. His tests are based off of really 90% lecture slides and 10 percent textbook. Take this class with him and you won't regret it, fail? Well it is on YOU as he literally gives you the answers

He genuinely cared about students' success. From the start, he said lectures weren't required, but rewarded attendees with extra credit. Exams came directly from the textbook or slides, so reading and reviewing them was enough to do well. His fairness and support made learning straightforward and rewarding. He answers any and all questions.

The prof is new this summer 2025 and he's terrible. Doesn't have a great way of explaining course materials and spit out a lot of equations when this is a course for Business Technology class and makes us memorize them for exams. In class he said if we don't get this one question on the exam we should “fail”. Not very encouraging.

This class was unnecessarily difficult! Meysam is a terrible prof. I could barely hear him in class and for the midterm, we had to study 7 chapters in total and all 12 chapters for the final exam. This semester, 40% of students covering both BUS 237 classes failed the midterm! If you need to take BUS 237, take with anyone but him!!

He is the new professor from Calgary, but is the worst professor. I couldn't understand anything in the lecture, just stated them and had very, very boring lectures, the midterm exam is harder than other professors. Avoid his courses lease!
Trapped, attendance in tutorials is 1000% mandatory. They take names, also for presentations you can't leave otherwise you also lose marks.

Puts minimal effort into explaining the lecture slides

Grading criteria are unclear and inconsistently communicated

Grades were changed even after being finalized and posted on goSFU

TA was not helpful and often unable to answer questions without referring to the answer key
= Avoid this prof

Stagnant prof, another review said he wouldn't do anything to help you unless it required effort on his part, that is an understatement. I'd highly recommend NOT taking this class with this prof at all costs. It's not too too hard to get a decent grade but he has a very bad mindset.

Course was hard to manage. Exams had low averages and the expectations for assignments and labs were unclear. Had to follow up multiple times just to get a correct letter grade. He fixed it, but only after I pointed it out. Track your marks and advocate for yourself.

Be prepared to teach yourself a lot, track your marks, and speak up for yourself.

Lectures were good and the prof cared but tutorials were useless, my TA barely explained what we were supposed to be doing, so most of us were just guessing half the time.Tests were super hard, tons of memorisation. Average was low. Also, why is this course mandatory? I don't need to know about semiconductors if I want to major in finance.

Terrible lectures, decent guy. Tutorials were mandatory but not too bad. Test heavy class with lots of memorization. Average was always extremely low. Tests were generally pretty difficult. Not a caring professor at all though however. I would not take this professor if you could choose anyone else

Ahmad is a solid professor. In BUS237 you'll be engaging more with TAs rather than Ahmad, he just runs the lectures and the slides are posted so many people don't go. Lectures can be dry at times because of the content of the class. His exams are fair, mostly multiple choice, class average was low and basically all memorization for the exams. e
lazy and gives minimal effort, wont do anything for students unless it requires 0 effort on his part
Very good professors and course experience, exams are a little difficult and require a very good understanding of the course content and concepts.
I love this professor! He is very patient and willing to teach his students! Highly recommended!
The lessons are boring, but this professor is the most recommended of all!
Boring lecture! Avoid at all cost! Makes life harder for students
Very good professor, I had a good time in this class. The workload and the class itself are very challenging, but Ahmad makes it easier to understand. Very engaging lectures and great tutorials.
Should attend all his lectures. Tests include examples from lectures.

I enjoyed this course, but wasn't fond of the syllabus. Assignments often took up a lot of time but weren't worth much. It was difficult working in groups, as some members never showed up to tutorial because they weren't mandatory. It was also difficult contacting group members while TAs were on strike

Professor Bisher has worked in the IS/IT field for many years, so he's quite knowledgeable in MIS. The course content itself can get quite technical at times, so the lectures aren't the most engaging. If you read the textbooks and attend lectures, you'll be alright. The labs are quite useful for asking questions but hardly anyone shows up

Ahmad is a great professor, approachable, and engaging in lectures. His grading criteria is very fair, and he gives students chances to bounce back from their grade if they struggle in an area. Overall, I think he is one of the better professors for this course.

This class is INSANELY boring, I genuinely cld not stay awake. I wish he would record his lectures because it's impossible to listen to him talk for 2hrs straight. The content itself is useful to know though. Read the textbook and do a the practice questions and exams are fine - assignments are also super tedious and time-consuming for no reason.
He's a really fun and engaging prof. If you go to his office hours, he's happy to walk you through to some of the concepts. Still haven't written the midterm but my friends said it was easy!

Lectures weren't required but were useful because he uses real life examples such as shopping with Amazon. If you do miss lectures, he records them. He expands on how MIS is used in the real world. The exams are solely memorization and application with most of the exam being multiple choice.
very good prof who wants you to succeed. All her assignments were graded fairly and were clearly outlined. Its best if you participate for your own good!

i think she was alright. The curve was insanely high though, i got a a mid 90 and ended the course with a A-. overall she was okay the exams were easy if you memorized the lecture slides and her lectures help you understand them. make sure to do really well on the big assignments and you'll get a high grade as long as you do mediocre on the exams
Not a helpful prof if you are in hard times!
he is the best prof, he is very caring and wants us to learn.
Very helpful. Genuinely cares about students and wants them to succeed.
The midterms and finals were very easy and straight forward.

Has one or two pop quiz that are not worth much but they are still quizzes, reads off the slides but actually bases his exam on the material in the slides, questions are not too hard they just test your basic understanding of the concepts, really a great person and understands if you are going through tough times, I really respect him a lot.
Nice guy but so boring!

He has alot of knowledge, and knows what he's teaching. But honeslty, he's very unhelpful. I really used to like Aish during few weeks, but he would make it very difficuilt to reach him. I often went to his office hours but he'll be late or unavailable. Most importantly, his lectures are not very helpful.

Going to have to disagree to alot of these reviews. My TA only followed the rubrics. Final was easy, if you followed his exam rubric. As well as if you attended class and paid attention to the case studies he went over. If you study and are good with computers this class is an Easy A. You have to study to get you mark but that goes for all classes.

Just took the final- breezed through it. oh? you thought cause it was easy and I was prepared well in class? no no! don't kid yourself! I guessed all the questions except the last one (good ol' #60). Just like the midterm, exam content covered less than 10% of the course material and they were extremely difficult -studying honestly won't help you.

What's extremely frustrating is that some of the content this course offers is actually valuable and useful, especially the second half. However the lectures and assignments were just so frustrating and annoying that it took away from it. If there's someone else to take it with it may be better.

Useless lectures and unorganized prof that I've ever seen. If you never go to lecture and only rely on textbook, this prof might be a fair choice. However, TA and prof never have communication. So whatever on the assignment rubric is not parallel with what your TA is looking for. So you might expect some marks will be deducted.

I don't disagree with many of these reviews, the course ended up being very disorganized because the teaching methods the prof engaged in. But saying that he cancelled MULTIPLE office hours is untrue, when he cancelled, the prof sent out emails to inform us that he was at the hospital with his wife as she was giving birth. Give him a break on that

Pretty easy going prof. He went over the midterm thoroughly with students, took their inputs and remarked. Everyone marks went up. Canceled only one office hour due to an emergency. Assignments are pretty easy going, lots of open labs to help. Students who dont do well tend to complain. This class is not as hard as people are portraying it to be.

Easily the nicest prof ever. He took off midterm questions that the class thought was confusing while other profs would just not care. He encourages in-class participation so sometimes tends to go overtime but makes sure to engage students and get feedback. Many real-life examples it was very interesting. Assignments are annoying but learned excel!

Uninspired and joyless are two terms that suit this professor quite well. Lectures left me feeling lost, frustrated and lost again. One of the assignments had convoluted instructions and felt like it should be 50% of the final marks. Weird tangents, weird in class assignments, weird time. If you can take this course w/ someone else, please do that.

Never thought I'd ever leave a comment on ratemyprof until I took this class. Literally so frustrating that I'm here now. Absolutely horrible & completely unorganized class. Prof tries so hard to sound smart, which just complicates your understanding. Lecture slides are so poorly written, that even the textbook fails to clarify them.

Overall he tried hard but his lectures were very unorganised. Midterms and exam had questions he made himself which did not make sense or they had more then one right answer. The assignments were made significantly worse due to really terrible instructions adding on unnecessary hours of tedious work. Tutorials are rushed, be ready to self-learn.

very knowledgeable pretty easy going prof, go to class and youll pass. The assignments are Easy A's. Midterm was based on just one concept but the concept was taught repeatedly in every single lecture.

Avoid at all costs. Horrible lecturer, so boring and not related to textbook. Exams are super ambiguous. If you fully understand the whole textbook and all class slides you will know about 75% of whats on the exam. 2 easy assignments and 1 Really really really hard long tedious one. Really not worth it in the end because of exams and trash lecture

Horrible Horrible proff. Impossible to listen to and understand. Lectures are jokes but mandatory. Worst part is that the exams are sooooo ambiguous. If you study slides and textbook multiple times over you would know about 75% of whats on the midterm. Horrible disorganized projects, avoid this proff at all costs.

one of most caring profs at SFU, takes student feedback and tries to help them. Assignments are super easy. He tells you what to study for if you go to class, has a couple pop quizzes but will tell you a week in advance. TAs are super helpful as well.

very caring and genuine. He is very knowledgeable and knows what hes talking about. study the slides and you will pass the course. He tells you what to study for and is great. Students who dont put in the work dont show up to class hence fail the midterm. Assignments are super easy as well its honestly and easy A coming from an avg student

You could tell he was trying however, he has broken english and often lectures were hard to understand. The course itself is not too difficult and he does follow the textbook so there are ways around his poor english. My specific TA was not great and marked extremely hard on the few assignments that were given.

Genuinely a great guy, really cares about his students and wants them to succeed. Semester isn't over yet but so far the midterm was mostly vague MCQ's & one of the individual assignments instructions were very vague as well. TA's bailed us out. Lab's were very useful. Lots of small easy assignments/pop quizzes so don't miss anything!

To start, his TA's basically carried the entire class, creating the only helpful assignments. His lectures focused too much on one topic that he would be caught up on, resulting in him not finishing his slides every single time. His midterm covered two topics for 70% of the test. Beyond this, his passion for teaching is clearly nonexistent.

"This class is a joke" literally sums up the entire thing. After the first couple lectures of the semester I realised how useless going to class is, as he tends to go on so many tangents that actual useful material is never covered. There is a large disconnect from the students and the prof because noone takes him seriously. Try to get another prof

This class is a joke. He never post his slides on canvas and it hard to follow. His midterm is ridiculous. he only tested on 3 stuff out of 6 chapters. He expect us to know stuff from outside the textbook too. Also, the instructions for his assignment is extremely unclear and no one knows what is going on. DONT TAKE HIS CLASS!

Decent professor who actually cares and listens to students but test questions are not intuitive, you have to actually understand the course material to do well on tests which make up most of your grade. Tutorials were not related to lectures and were poorly executed by the TA.

Absolutely frustrating. Assignments were broadly explained and made use of skills we were barely taught. T.A's weren't very helpful. Midterm made up of only two topics out of the many others that he said in the lecture, the rest were true/false questions that were exceptionally hard. He even had to add marks to everyone because of this.

I actually really enjoy his class. He is one of the most caring profs at SFU, very open to feedback and tries to engage the class. He is very clear with the marking criteria theres a rubric attached so if anyone complains about it its on them for not reading it.

Can't understand him. He expects you to be Bill Gates when this is an intro to tech course. The assignments are absolutely terribly directed- instructions are ambiguously worded and contradicting. He doesn't care about his students and I've learned absolutely nothing in this course. My brain cell count went down 300% and so did my 4.0 GPA.

The course isnt that hard but the way everything is organized makes it frustrating. Assignments arent explained clearly and are totally unrelated to the lectures and tutorials. Lectures are dry as he pretty much just reads off the slides and talks about things that arent going to be asked on the exam.

Terrible class with ridiculous assignments. Instructions for all assignments were extremely unclear, and skills needed to complete them were barely taught, if even at all. Assignments were very time consuming and had nothing to do with anything. Previous comments about the midterm were accurate. Overall a very poor experience

Probably one of the worst profs I've ever had. His lectures are irrelevant to tutorials, and very dry. Good luck trying to stay awake in class, less than 50% actually shows up. He is a horrible lecturer and doesn't know how to take control of the room. Midterm was started 35 mins late and filled with unfair tricky true and false questions.

This prof tested approximately 35 MC questions on the midterm, 10 questions on a specific topic, 10 questions on another specific topic and the last few are random Truth/False questions that are just so tough to answer. His lectures are also extremely difficult to understand, even though he is very passionate about the course. Don't take it!!

His exam wasn't even related to the textbook. He literally tested us on 2 topic and related like 80% of the true and false question to Porter's 5 forces, and tested us on Database/the Cloud. I basically wasted days of time studying for things that weren't tested. He also lied saying the quiz is gonna be similar, but clearly wasn't the case.
Homie tested us on like 2 topics the entire midterm. They weren't even the significant ones either. It doesn't matter how much time you spent studying, if you didn't study these 2, you're done.

Really liked Aish as a prof, the course, on the other hand, was pretty boring and dry but nothing you can really do about that. He was definitely passionate about the course and knew all his stuff. He was also very open to compromise whether it was extending due dates or literally changing exam times. Super nice guy, has an accent but it's all good

Great guy! New teacher, so there is obviously an adjustment period. Students seem to complain about the tests not being similar to the textbook, and that is just false. I wrote the midterm at got basically an A, through studying primarily through the textbook, maybe that person was reading a biology book? He gave the students 5 bonus points!
Tests are fair. Come to class and participate if you want to do well. Lot's of little assignments worth a fair bit. Average for the first midterm was 66%.

Passionate about the subject but terrible at teaching. His midterm was very different from the textbook; the first couple chapter quizzes had questions that weren't available in the textbook. We also can't see what we answered wrong. Assignments require a lot of time especially the lab assignments, roughly 2-3 hours for 1.67%.

Dr. Goh was a very nice professor. I appreciated her kindness throughout my time in her class and she took many suggestions students made to heart throughout the course. I think in the beginning it was a bit difficult as lectures had many hiccups, but near the end it went well. The participation credit during lecture helps & flashcards for exams.
Tutorials are attendance mandatory and they have ABsolutely nothing to do with the course content. Exams are like definition based

Jie Goh was a very supportive professor and always answered my questions. Friendly and caring, with clear grading criteria in tutorials. The exams were mostly multiple choice with some short answer questions, primarily based on lecture content with a little bit from the textbook. Taking this class has confirmed my interest in pursuing MIS.

She is hard to hear and understand during lecture, and lectures are incredibly boring. She includes questions on exams based on 2-minute discussions conducted in lecture that are so easy to miss. Like seriously, stick to the textbook and slides. Writing is also bad and sometimes impossible to read. Try to avoid. That said, she is nice. Good person.

Dr. JM Goh changed how I thought of MIS. The course had all the potential of being very dry but her teachings added value to the textbook readings. She would link the lecture to real use cases and illustrate how large companies are implementing IS. She was always available for extra help and helped me through all my questions. AMAZING PERSON!
Excellent
Not my favorite prof. Dry lecture and quite a lot of assignments for a 200 level course. Show no mercy to absolutely any request so definitely avoid taking her class.

The lectures are dry but she uses in class discussions on exams and the exams are completely different than you would expect based on the weekly quizzes. The grading scheme does not make sense and doesn't fit the amount of time you have to put in for certain assignments.

Her lectures are pretty dry, as they are straight from the textbook. But you have to attend her lectures because she uses a different set of slides in the lecture - the discussion questions are used in the exams. Get ready to work, b/c there are weekly quizzes and the group project isn't always the best....

AVOID. Very dull and useless lectures - they were a complete regurgitation of the textbook. Yet, you are forced to attend lectures in order to take note of "discussions" (which are testable for 40% of midterm and final). No way to know what was "discussed" unless you show up since she uploads different slides than the ones shown in class.
Wild time in that class, the blue words on the slides are your best friend.

Honestly Connie isn't as bad as people say. You can tell she is passionate about teaching but there is room for improvement. She made the class interactive and brought candy to class. She also tells you what to focus on for studying for the final. You just have to listen to her and attend lecture daily. Material can be dry but that's not on her.

People who leave reviews don't attend the lectures. You can't expect high grades without making any effort. She doesn't go through the slides as they mainly contain definitions. She focuses on important topics that usually aren't on the slides, which she usually asks on the exams. Attend the lectures and actually listen to what she's saying.

Worst professor at Beedie. I couldn't understand anything in the lecture, she didn't explain concepts just stated them and has very, very boring lectures, like everyone stopped showing up 2 weeks in. She complains about ratings like these in lecture as well, blaming the students instead of reflecting on what she can improve on. CMON CONNIE.
Dolores Umbridge

final was open book but if you dunno the concepts your gonna be wasting ur time flipping through your notes. slides are mainly copy and paste from textbook so u don't rlly need to go to lecture. tutorial attendance is mandatory. overall Connies nice, but the lectures are pretty boring. tbh you won't learn from her lectures, just read the textbook
absolute cheeks
Honestly don't get the hate, she is completely fine, all the exams are fair in my opinion. All the people that complain don't show up and expect to ace the course

Connie is not a good professor. BUT she is the only one that teaches this course so i will give advice. Read the textbook and memorize the slides for midterm. Final is all application which she gives examples of questions int he second half of the semester. She is very all over the place in her lectures. Wouldn't reccommend if you have a choice.
As a chinese, XI XING PING would put her to the sweat shops
I wouldn't like to get lectured a introduction to MIS, paying thousands, for a professor who is just... dissapointing at it

The professor is clearly inadequate for the course and needs extra brushing up on IT standards. 
She uses html buttons with COMIC SANS that redirect to other buttons in the canvas page (aka useless)
Her lectures are worthless, just knowing how to use a computer is enough to pass this class.

They teach you microsoft excel and office in big 2024 ffs

I hated this course when I was in it, but the material is interesting and useful for other business courses. While Connie's individual lectures can be hard to understand, she tries to connect everything together - understanding these connections is the key to succeeding. The assignments are straightforward. She allows notes during the final.

Overall bad prof. Lectures have no connections with each other, she does not seem to care about students and their grades, and the heavy Chinese accent makes all of it even worse (Still wonder how an international student like myself can speak better English than the prof). Avoid at all costs.
You need to understand the connections and relationships she is making.  Do not memorize things, it won't help you in this class.

Unorganized lectures, course structure, and marking. Will often not read slides and tell students to read them because reading the slides "are not worth her time." Overall bad prof in all ways if you can avoid her do it, but if not you'll just have a bad experience.

Midterm: Solely memorization
Final (open book): Half MC Half Short Answer
On the last day of lectures she literally tells you the kind of questions shes going to ask on the short answer. One piece advice I can give for this class is to understand the purpose and why &how everything connects together since Short A is about applying the concepts.

Connie is very real-world oriented.  She will give you the knowledge, but asks that you use critical thinking skills.  BUS 237 is NOT an information recall class, this is where students fail and blame her for being tough.  She is fair and very helpful, but not easy.  She expects students to be responsible, study and ask questions. Like an adult..

Honestly i think the biggest issue i found with her class is that there is no consistency. Her assignments in no way help you understand the concepts as they are totally unrelated. She does not teach the big concepts properly which is frustrating as the final was all about applying concepts. The midterm however was more memorization.

Connie is a nice prof (YES you can 100% understand her, I'm not sure why people are so affected by a minor accent), but the course content is just so heavy that the finals and midterm are a giant mess where you apply concepts you haven't learnt properly in the first place. There is simply TOO MUCH content to learn properly + homework is unrelated.

Unclear assignments, vague and inconsistent grading schemes, and useless lectures. Not only that, she can barely speak English, so if you have any questions whatsoever, she will not help you. Overall, speaking from personal experience she is arguably the worst prof in Beedie.

Connie's 237 course is difficult because the midterm and final are difficult to prepare for -- if you attend class, understand the big concepts, and be engaged, you'll do well. Connie is super caring and genuinely a very nice person.

Honestly, her assignments aren't too bad and 50% of the class grade is non-test related work. Her midterm was ok, its just a lot of content to learn and memorize. However she is a awful lecturer. Her explanations are overly complex and confuse you more then actually help. She wants you to understand EVERYTHING but makes it unnecessarily hard.
The reviews are right overall.

Very hard to follow and lacks effective teaching skills. Big group project so you need to hope you get a good group. Final exam felt completely unrelated to the course material and exam questions were worded very poorly, leaving questions open to different interpretations. Overall, you're not going to get your money's worth with this professor.

Honestly, just prepare yourself lecture is her just reading off slides and at some point she lets you know she wouldnt even read of a slide because you can do it yourseld. Exams are very much and she gives you a shockingly short time. Overall No.
Definitely a yapper, goes on and on about stuff that isn't important.
Reads off slides all lecture, but puts pop quizzes that were inaccessible from outside of class. The final exam was very unrelated to the material she suggested we study.

Connie is not as bad as she seems, she is actually pretty funny and tries her best to engage the class by throwing candy. Didn't love her lectures, the content is basically a copy and paste from the textbook and she goes over the slides super fast, that's when she doesn't skip them. Super strict about cheating and will not hesitate to give you a 0.

Pros: Fun unique fashion sense, throws candy for participation, tries to engage class with mentimeter and jeoprady, makes jokes, office full of sadness from inside out mini figures
Cons: Lots of assignments, explanations/analogies can be drawn out, slightly paranoid about contract cheaters
Overall, she's a good and caring teacher just focus in lec

People give Connie a hard time just because they want everything to be easy. If you're a student who hates boring, static lectures (like most SFU average joe profs), try Connie. Lectures are very dynamic and informative if you ACTUALLY LISTEN. She teaches like a REAL university professor, as you have to think critically to understand the course.

Honestly, Connie is a nice person if she is your friends, but I am sure Connie is not very nice if she is your professor. It is super hard to follow her during the lecture cuz it was so boring and dry. I got a lot of help from TA Qixin. So please see your TA if you want a high assignment mark.

I do not know why she is rated so poorly. She taught well and cleared doubts properly too. Hope for a good TA. If one fails or does not do well in her class is because they did not complete their assignments well. Our midterm was an MCQ one and the final was straightforward as well.

Don't understand the hate at all. I found Connie to be caring for her students and extremely knowledgeable on the subject matter. The assignments are hard, and marked strictly. But she will give you everything you need in the lectures to succeed. I never needed to consult outside material like I do with other classes. Strongly recommend!

Connie is sweet, but I found her lectures to be useless.

To sum it up, she was very inconsistent and confusing in both teaching and grading. Never have I seen such an unengaged class. 

You only have to do the Microsoft office lessons through MyITLab to pass this class. All the exam questions can be found directly from Quizlet.

If you've never felt lost in life before, this class will change that. A complete blur of disarray and chaos, rambles of words disguised as "lectures", and multi-hour lengthy assignments create an atmosphere that lacks the motivation to contribute anything more than the bare minimum for this course. 

if options arise, pick them instead of Connie.
Connie gets too much hate. She's really smart and funny; it's clear she cares about doing her job well. She can be hard to understand at times, but her enthusiasm almost makes up for it

Awful! Connie deserves 0 stars. The lectures were useless, but you have to attend them to get participation marks. My TA was not too bad, but Connie was a nightmare. MyITLab is trash (takes 4 hours to complete an assignment) and all the assignments are only worth 5% of your overall. AVOID AT ALL COSTS! Assignment 2 was very strictly graded. AVOID!
If I could give this course a 0, I would. The course is a mess, just like the person teaching it.

This course is traumatizing because it teaches you to think the way Connie thinks, her exams are structured the way where you opinion could lead you failing this course as questions are mostly opinion based.

Connie although is a good person outside of her course. The amount of ego she maintained was pressuring. The course itself is supposed to be engrossing; however her lecture presentation is very poor and disorganized. You could feel that she tries to improve some aspects of it, but her definitions of fairness are so vague that she ends up unfair.
Rambles on and on. No clear point of lectures. Pointless class, do not take if it isn't absolutely mandatory.

I found Connie to be very nice and willing to help. As a person she's really nice! Her teaching style isn't the most intriguing and can get very confusing because she tends to go on many tangents. It's a pretty average course with quite a bit of group work. The individual assignments aren't super hard but are very tedious and long.

Okay, I just needed to come on here because I think most of the reviews are VERY misleading. I was afraid to take this class because of them! But, honestly Dr. Liu is not bad at all! She is very helpful if you need to go talk to her in office hours. I also think that her lectures are easy to follow and she provides examples to help you understand.

I do think Connie's lecturing style can be very hard to follow since she rambles a lot, but this course itself is designed poorly. Luckily, her exams are pretty easy and the assignments, though overwhelming, aren't too difficult either, so for that reason I wouldnt mind taking her again.

Connie seems nice enough but she's just not fit for teaching. Her lectures are very disorganized and half the time she just rambles about stuff and it's hard to even recognize what is testable and what is just her getting distracted. The course material itself isn't too difficult but the course expectations are very unclear.

Extremely disorganized class. Grading rubrics are not clear whatsoever so no one knows how to even complete the assignments. Connie also samples her exams from quizlets so everyone cheated and brought up the average. Avoid Connie.

Connie is very disorganized. She just read off the slides and start ranting about everything else, without any contribution to the material. Her assignments never align with the instructions. Everything is very vague. Most of the exams are on the internet so basically everyone took advantage of it. Time-consuming assignments, only worth a few %.

Do not take a class with Connie! She just doesn't know how to teach, her lectures are very disorganized, which makes it hard to learn anything. The course material is not difficult, but the way Connie teaches it makes it much more confusing than it needs to be.

Very disorganized and confusing class. No one knows what's going on and even TAs agree that assignment rubrics are confusing. Course material is not hard whatsoever but assignments are hardly related to what we learn in this class. Avoid Connie unless you want to stare at the assignment criterias for hours and still not know how to start.

Very disorganized during lectures, and sometimes rambles/strays away from the topic + messy writing. Always contradicting herself on assignment rubrics and due dates. She knows her stuff, but her delivery of the course makes it difficult for students to grasp that knowledge. Her exam questions are based more on what she says than her actual notes.

Connie seemed like she had no clue what she was doing yet maintained a huge ego. She didn't even understand her own grading rubric and would change the format as she went. Classes were extremely boring and unorganized. A lot of the material she taught is out-of-date and irrelevant. Overall her class was a terrible experience, would not recommend.
the last review was her, she quoted her self from lecture

Do not treat this course as a tech course, Connie is inspiring students to think out of the box rather than stuffing everything you need to know for the exam. Overall I find it easy for this course, it just so much homework and deadlines change occasionally. Final exam is not related to the course content, it requires thinking not memorization.

I would recommend choosing a different prof. The course structure is so disorganized and the prof makes the course harder than it should be. You would never get straight answers always ambiguous responses leaving the entire class confused on how to do an assignment. Overall, poor structure and you teach your self everything.

Caring but very disorganized. Assignments were very useful. Youll get through it but tell her what she needs to fix, she welcomes feedback. Everyone cheated on the tests so average was too high. I didnt cheat and got same mark as those who did. Final exam did not relate to main course concepts or things she emphasized. Good luck<3

Very confusing lectures, no organization and she always goes over the time allotted for every lecture. Assignments were somewhat easy; however, she likes to give a lot of assignments in a short period of time. Wish she would give more clarity throughout the course. Also, I wasted so much money on a textbook I never used.

Connie's lectures are extremely dry, disorganized and it becomes very hard to follow along. Her teaching style made the class way harder than it needed to be as expectations were not clearly explained regarding assignments or exams. Do yourself a favour and take this class with a different prof!

Lots of work and confusing lectures and assignments. The instruction made this class harder than it needed to be as we couldnt get clarification on what was expected of us on assignments or further explanation of class material when it was confusing.

Lectures were dry and hard to follow bc she rambles. Would not have attended if it wasnt mandatory as It felt like a waste of time. Assignment heavy with unclear instructions. Some assignments are tedious that is worth little at the end. Nice person but is not accommodating to students and found her condescending at times. Unclear exam expectation

Oh, where do I start? Boring lectures, rambles a lot, not that accessible, unwilling to accommodate to the online learning environment, super vague and confusing assignment criteria, exams and lectures do not match, expects too much for a first year course. She's a nice person, but unfortunately not a good professor at all. Avoid if you can.

connie is a really sweet and caring person, however, her lectures are the worst. she needs to be more organised and reduce the course load because there is just so many components and most of it, you have to figure it out by yourself. although, she's an amazing person, would not recommend taking it with her because she the worst lecturer.

She backloaded the course which sucked. First half only had a couple minor assignments. Second half had 3 major assignments, 2 minor ones and a presentation. Connie seems to be a nice person but actually is not very accommodating. This was particularly disheartening to during a pandemic.

She is such a sweet prof who genuinely cares and tries her best to accodomate. However, the way she teaches the topics makes it difficult to understand because she goes off topic a lot during lectures.

she is a nice person, but as a professor, the worst I have had at SFU, she is very unorganized, her lectures are extremely boring, and she doesn't help in any way to make them more interesting. All her assignment have horrible instructions, that leads to her having to clarify the instructions and make them clearer through announcements and emails.

She is such a sweetheart and really caring. She really goes out of her way to ensure her students understand the course concepts, especially if you go to her with questions. However, she is not a great lecturer. She bounces all over the place and really isn't clear. Def need the textbook for this class.
Worst class I have ever taken and the content wasn't even hard. Do yourself a favour and take 237 later if Connie is your only choice.

Connie was super lovely, however, she was the most disorganized prof I have ever had and this made the course way more challenging than it should ever be. I had no idea when things were due because she seemingly picked random dates off a calendar. Projects were due on days that we didn't have lectures or tutorials and late projects get a zero.

This is Connie's first semester teaching in Canada, however, her class design is very poor. Her grading scheme was inaccurate and changed throughout the semester, assignments do not provide good instructions, and exam questions do not reflect the content she discusses in class.

Connie is caring, kind. She should make the course more concise, coherent, less confusing. Too many assignments; asks you to figure out how to complete them. Lecture notes are confusing; listen to her and note what she refers to as "important". Why do we need lectures when the textbook is already so comprehensive? STRICT deadlines :( Love her cats!

Its impossible to understand what shes saying, her accent is terrible. 98% of her lectures are off topic. Attendance is mandatory otherwise you loose a lot of marks, but once you get to the lecture you wont understand her at all. Youll have to rely on the book and lecture slides, the recordings wont help because its impossible to decipher.
